relations.evidence: Bill Ackman is the founder and CEO of Pershing Square Capital Management.

actors.summary_2to5_sentences: Bill Ackman is the founder and CEO of Pershing Square Capital Management, a New York-based investment firm. He is known for his activist investing strategy and has made significant public bets on companies like Amazon and Google. Ackman has been a prominent figure in the financial world since the early 2000s. His firm, Pershing Square Capital Management, is listed on the NYSE under the ticker PSQ.
queries_run: Bill Ackman Pershing Square Capital Management official site

relations.evidence: Amazon and Google are major competitors in cloud computing and digital advertising.
Amazon uses Google Cloud for some of its infrastructure needs.

actors.summary_2to5_sentences: Amazon.com, Inc. is a multinational technology company headquartered in Seattle, Washington. It operates in e-commerce, cloud computing (via Amazon Web Services), digital streaming, and artificial intelligence. The company is publicly traded on the NASDAQ under the ticker AMZN. Amazon is one of the world's largest online retailers and a leading provider of cloud infrastructure services.

relations.evidence: Google and Amazon are major competitors in cloud computing and digital advertising.
Google Cloud is used by Amazon for certain infrastructure needs.

actors.summary_2to5_sentences: Alphabet Inc. is the parent company of Google, a multinational technology company headquartered in Mountain View, California. It operates in search engines, online advertising, cloud computing, operating systems, and hardware. Alphabet is publicly traded on the NASDAQ under the ticker GOOGL. Google is one of the most widely used search engines globally and a dominant player in digital advertising.

symbols.summary_2to5_sentences: Amazon.com, Inc. is a multinational technology company headquartered in Seattle, Washington. It operates in e-commerce, cloud computing (via Amazon Web Services), digital streaming, and artificial intelligence. The company is publicly traded on the NASDAQ under the ticker AMZN. Amazon is one of the world's largest online retailers and a leading provider of cloud infrastructure services.

Alphabet Inc. is the parent company of Google, a multinational technology company headquartered in Mountain View, California. It operates in search engines, online advertising, cloud computing, operating systems, and hardware. Alphabet is publicly traded on the NASDAQ under the ticker GOOGL. Google is one of the most widely used search engines globally and a dominant player in digital advertising.

Crown Castle International Corp. is a real estate investment trust (REIT) that owns and operates wireless communication infrastructure in the United States. It provides cell tower and small cell infrastructure to wireless carriers. The company is listed on the NYSE under the ticker CP. Crown Castle is a key player in the U.S. telecommunications infrastructure sector.

Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. is a global hospitality company that operates and franchises hotels and resorts under brands such as Hilton, Waldorf Astoria, and Conrad. It is listed on the NYSE under the ticker HLT. The company is one of the largest hotel operators in the world, with a presence in over 120 countries.

Hertz Global Holdings, Inc. is a multinational automotive rental company headquartered in Estero, Florida. It operates one of the largest car rental networks in the world, with brands including Hertz, Dollar, and Thrifty. The company is listed on the NYSE under the ticker HTZ. Hertz has faced financial challenges in recent years, including bankruptcy reorganization.
